title: Malzahar Passive Op
body: Riot needs to fix Malzahar's passive, just played a game with a top lane Malzahar on the enemy team and every single time we fought him he had his stupid passive active meaning that he was spell immune.  Especially seeing as the only way to stop malzahar is to cc him when he ults or  tries to this is especially bad for his balance.  Now he has become too powerful seeing as he will constantly shrug off other ap champtions and will become the one mage who can't be taken down by cc anymore.

Uh, no.
It reduces all damage taken within the first one second it's triggered.
Therefore, if you spam an entire rotation of abilities/CC on him within 1 second, all damage from that entire rotation will be reduced by 90%, while all the CC will be nullified.
So don't spam a rotation of abilities on him in 1 second. Counter Malzahar with poke and you're fine. Even auto attacks work.
Or, you'd have to attack him anyways to pop the shield, then back off and wait a second without letting him get away, unless you either want to be killed or you want him to just escape.

So treat a malzahar with shield like you treat a Tryndamere with ult. You either keep up with him for a second while his shield's up, then cc the shit out of him and kill him or you just let him run away (and not burn any major cooldowns in the process). If you're so far behind that you can't survive for one second while a Malzahar's shield is taken down, you probably lost anyway.

Except unlike Trynd, Malzahar's passive CD is 23-4s depending on his level.
And even if he doesn't kill you, between suppress + silence, you're not going to be doing much before he either does finish it off or just run back away.

It sounds like you're just having issues fighting him. Those 4 seconds have to be uninterrupted periods of no direct damage. Throw a low CD spell at him or an auto. His silence is not hard to dodge, and his suppression is on a long enough cd that it shouldn't matter all that much.

If you catch him out, he will die. End of story.
